subject: Show all roles in inventory
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin André', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 17888, 'name': 'Florian Fuchs', 'email': 'f@florianfuchs.com', 'username': 'flfuchs'}, {'_account_id': 18002, 'name': 'John Fulton', 'email': 'fulton@redhat.com', 'username': 'fultonj'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2017-05-10 13:13:29.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tripleo_validations/tests/test_inventory.py', 'scripts/tripleo-ansible-inventory', 'tripleo_validations/inventory.py'], 'message': 'Show all roles in inventory

This patch updates the tripleo-ansible-inventory to show all roles in
the host list, not just compute and controller nodes.

The retrieval of IPs and stack outputs is slightly refactored: Instead of
retrieving them from Nova, the host IPs are now read from the stacks new
RoleNetIpMap output. The stack outputs are fetched from heat via a new
`StackOutputs` class that ensures outputs are only fetched when needed.

Closes-Bug: #1685544
Closes-Bug: #1689789
Change-Id: Ic8a19f15dd45b383a3f3d403653e3eaef2c1865b
'}]
commit_message:
Show all roles in inventory

This patch updates the tripleo-ansible-inventory to show all roles in
the host list, not just compute and controller nodes.

The retrieval of IPs and stack outputs is slightly refactored: Instead of
retrieving them from Nova, the host IPs are now read from the stacks new
RoleNetIpMap output. The stack outputs are fetched from heat via a new
`StackOutputs` class that ensures outputs are only fetched when needed.

Closes-Bug: #1685544
Closes-Bug: #1689789
Change-Id: Ic8a19f15dd45b383a3f3d403653e3eaef2c1865b

subject: Convert first ironic_client test to REST
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-14 12:51:02.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_shade_operator.py', 'shade/tests/unit/fixtures/catalog-v3.json', 'shade/tests/fakes.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Convert first ironic_client test to REST

Add the various plumbing and convert one test.

Also, ironicclient prepends "v1" to all of its calls (joy) so there is
an ugly transition related to version discovery coming with this one.
For now just prepend it in our mock base class. When we convert calls,
we'll have to prepend v1 at the call site until we're done with the
transition. Then we can do a followup patch that'll do discovery and
remove the v1 from the code. Gross.

Change-Id: Icfd70267910d19a7da2ae8e9b9e4f24d2077b87d
'}]
commit_message:
Convert first ironic_client test to REST

Add the various plumbing and convert one test.

Also, ironicclient prepends "v1" to all of its calls (joy) so there is
an ugly transition related to version discovery coming with this one.
For now just prepend it in our mock base class. When we convert calls,
we'll have to prepend v1 at the call site until we're done with the
transition. Then we can do a followup patch that'll do discovery and
remove the v1 from the code. Gross.

Change-Id: Icfd70267910d19a7da2ae8e9b9e4f24d2077b87d

commit_message:
Fixes unit tests

Latest releases of oslo.config enforces the config options'
types, which means that unit tests that override the default
values with mock.sentinel values are not working properly anymore.

This patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: Id1a3fb7168bde310c574c373e33675ae4373a88e

commit_message:
Support no validation of internal SSL endpoints

If self-signed certificates are used for internal endpoints
the current implementation will fail as there is no option
to turn off the certificate validation.

This patch implements a new variable to do so.

Change-Id: I64a80716a8636ab978071e9e6c7aaa19962547ec
(cherry picked from commit 8b7fc595e7b636b07b54fd9be07f9da9bb6e52d2)

commit_message:
Merge v21 view builder for ips API

Now v2 and v2.1 code is merged and we do not need
to maintain the different set of view builder.
Previously there were different way of building the
complete response for ips API. v2 used to do with extension
and v2.1 with view builder itself.

Part of bp:api-no-more-extensions

Change-Id: I438fdec60c221e2449203523e7c6fbae21b75604

subject: Clear all bgp peer connection when delete bgp peer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-16 00:24:30.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_neutron_api.py', 'dragonflow/neutron/services/bgp/bgp_plugin.py', 'dragonflow/controller/df_bgp_service.py'], 'message': 'Clear all bgp peer connection when delete bgp peer

Neutron allows delete bgp peer that is still used by bgp speakers. The
relationship between bgp peer and bgp speaker will be deleted automatically
with bgp_db.BgpSpeakerPeerBinding.
Dragonflow needs to update its bgp speakers in nb db when bgp peer is deleted,
so that the underlying service can update the actual bgp connections.

Change-Id: I0f67b459453f8d90c48a345e18ec19897136d361
Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing
'}]
commit_message:
Clear all bgp peer connection when delete bgp peer

Neutron allows delete bgp peer that is still used by bgp speakers. The
relationship between bgp peer and bgp speaker will be deleted automatically
with bgp_db.BgpSpeakerPeerBinding.
Dragonflow needs to update its bgp speakers in nb db when bgp peer is deleted,
so that the underlying service can update the actual bgp connections.

Change-Id: I0f67b459453f8d90c48a345e18ec19897136d361
Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing

commit_message:
Enable ssh validation in neutron-full

The -ssh job with ssh validation enabled has been quite stable
for a while now [0] so I think it's time to add ssh validation
to the integration gate to prevent regressions from lurking in.

We can stop running the -ssh job on tempest check/gate, but
I think it still provides value to have different periodic
jobs since it can provide a useful baseline when investigating
issues.

[0] http://status.openstack.org/openstack-health/#/g/build_name/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ssh?duration=P3M

Change-Id: I9f7a50c1ab136f8a8e7a4a84b374bf4e857e1995

By having this discovery hack in here we're really working around a

the python ecosystem moves across it cleanly, and everything else is

commit_message:
WIP: remove discover hacks

By having this discovery hack in here we're really working around a
breaking catalog change in keystone with client code, which means that
the python ecosystem moves across it cleanly, and everything else is
going to get broken.

We should see how big the fallout is on removing this.

Change-Id: Ie8b0405c83793ef935434affcfc2b2d701e73533

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-13 19:58:52.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/access/service_catalog.py', 'doc/source/using-sessions.rst'], 'message': "Make docs about interface less authoritative

There are a lot of statements made in the keystoneauth1 documentation
about the `interface` field which sound a lot more authoritative than
what they are. They are mostly just conventions used by clouds because
devstack inherited them from rackspace. They don't have string
meanings, and stating that they do will create the wrong expectations
on users and developers, including projects locking down the values
that interface can be in their project.

Change-Id: Ie03010ef0666a6aded053fa855910c9e18eab9cf
"}]
commit_message:
Make docs about interface less authoritative

There are a lot of statements made in the keystoneauth1 documentation
about the `interface` field which sound a lot more authoritative than
what they are. They are mostly just conventions used by clouds because
devstack inherited them from rackspace. They don't have string
meanings, and stating that they do will create the wrong expectations
on users and developers, including projects locking down the values
that interface can be in their project.

Change-Id: Ie03010ef0666a6aded053fa855910c9e18eab9cf

subject: TC to have approve authority on maintenance-mode projects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-28 10:59:54.000000000', 'files': ['reference/tags/status_maintenance-mode.rst'], 'message': 'TC to have approve authority on maintenance-mode projects

If a project enters maintenance mode, the response time on critical
things ends up being very much in question. For any project where that
happens it seems like the TC should take ownership as approvers to
ensure some base line responsiveness (and that there is someone to
help land critical patches).

Change-Id: I568c5c4fd43a95aa96d24218def90d9f894ff36b
'}]
commit_message:
TC to have approve authority on maintenance-mode projects

If a project enters maintenance mode, the response time on critical
things ends up being very much in question. For any project where that
happens it seems like the TC should take ownership as approvers to
ensure some base line responsiveness (and that there is someone to
help land critical patches).

Change-Id: I568c5c4fd43a95aa96d24218def90d9f894ff36b

commit_message:
Use zuul-cloner for tests repo in OpenStack-CI

When executing the tests repo clone in OpenStack-CI,
use zuul-cloner instead of git to enable cross-repo
testing. This ensures that if a dependent patch from
the tests repo is noted using 'Depends-On: <change-id>'
in the commit message, that patch will be included.

Depends-On: Idce7abebf32f24c356a27e099fbca954d917402b
Depends-On: I5da7802d61d2ab6b03908138e3a3ed2db22e3d29
Change-Id: Ie027302841a31913ca98dfcb2a6d227986f434ae

subject: Reduce init restart/kill times
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-05-16 11:26:53.000000000', 'files': ['templates/almanach-systemd-init.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/almanach_init_time_settings-1ef46f6b9d4fc1df.yaml'], 'message': "Reduce init restart/kill times

The systemd unit 'TimeoutSec' value which controls the time
between sending a SIGTERM signal and a SIGKILL signal when
stopping or restarting the service has been reduced from 300
seconds to 120 seconds. This provides 2 minutes for long-lived
sessions to drain while preventing new ones from starting
before a restart or a stop.

The 'RestartSec' value which controls the time between the
service stop and start when restarting has been reduced from
150 seconds to 2 seconds to make the restart happen faster.

These values can be adjusted by using the *_init_config_overrides
variables which use the config_template task to change template
defaults.

Change-Id: I9cbf75b0e219f92f41014b19931206c19cb8a0fe
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce init restart/kill times

The systemd unit 'TimeoutSec' value which controls the time
between sending a SIGTERM signal and a SIGKILL signal when
stopping or restarting the service has been reduced from 300
seconds to 120 seconds. This provides 2 minutes for long-lived
sessions to drain while preventing new ones from starting
before a restart or a stop.

The 'RestartSec' value which controls the time between the
service stop and start when restarting has been reduced from
150 seconds to 2 seconds to make the restart happen faster.

These values can be adjusted by using the *_init_config_overrides
variables which use the config_template task to change template
defaults.

Change-Id: I9cbf75b0e219f92f41014b19931206c19cb8a0fe

commit_message:
Add verify_on_create for remote resources

All resources have the ability to set verify_on_create so that
it creates a resource and then waits for the resource to show up.
Let's add this parameter to remote resources as well.

Change-Id: I1db31dcc92b8695ab0522bba91df729b37f34e0f

subject: Document testing of new devstack features
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-12 17:19:00.000000000', 'files': ['HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Document testing of new devstack features

At the Boston 2017 Summit I had mentioned that the pattern of using non
voting/experimental jobs was not working for getting new features into
Devstack. It is slow and leads people to being too conservative when it
comes to pushing new things in. Instead I suggested that since Devstack
changes are self testing we add the features, have change that enables
the feature, and if that changes passes we move forward with merging
(assuming code review is fine and necessary communication is done).

Document this process in the HACKING file so that we have something we
can point to when people want to add a new experimental job for every
new little thing (ipv6, tls, systemd, etc).

Change-Id: I5190cc3d3de4e81d52748347306133b5034d5531
'}]
commit_message:
Document testing of new devstack features

At the Boston 2017 Summit I had mentioned that the pattern of using non
voting/experimental jobs was not working for getting new features into
Devstack. It is slow and leads people to being too conservative when it
comes to pushing new things in. Instead I suggested that since Devstack
changes are self testing we add the features, have change that enables
the feature, and if that changes passes we move forward with merging
(assuming code review is fine and necessary communication is done).

Document this process in the HACKING file so that we have something we
can point to when people want to add a new experimental job for every
new little thing (ipv6, tls, systemd, etc).

Change-Id: I5190cc3d3de4e81d52748347306133b5034d5531

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-08 11:30:28.000000000', 'files': ['inc/python', 'lib/nova_plugins/functions-libvirt'], 'message': "uninstall libvirt-python and reinstall

libvirt-python compiles against the currently installed libvirt. If
you upgrade that, it needs to rebuild, however it won't change
versions, so pip install just noops. Force an uninstall / reinstall of
it every time to handle potential upgrades of libvirt.

Change-Id: If34541b34aa6d55eedaf6c603fd1fe92eb887308
"}]
commit_message:
uninstall libvirt-python and reinstall

libvirt-python compiles against the currently installed libvirt. If
you upgrade that, it needs to rebuild, however it won't change
versions, so pip install just noops. Force an uninstall / reinstall of
it every time to handle potential upgrades of libvirt.

commit_message:
libvirt: Use SubclassSignatureTestCase on all volume drivers

Change I01c908ad implemented this test for all subclasses of
LibvirtBaseFileSystemVolumeDriver. It's more generally applicable,
though, so this change moves the test up a level to all subclasses of
LibvirtBaseVolumeDriver.

Change-Id: I2089f6296781a989b111090595abd943c7882714

commit_message:
Use upper constraints for mitaka

This commit makes two changes:
        * make use of upper constraints for mitaka in tox to get rid
          of manully pinned requirements
        * get rid of the assert_called_once() call, which was never
          present in mock
        * get rid of the assert_called() call, which is not present
          in mock 1.3.0

Closes-Bug: #1685783
Change-Id: I9bb9c7c90ad8f3ddc14f1c6709376acc3b5e3395

subject: WIP - DON'T MERGE: Add option for deploying ssh keys to nova users
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-11-29 22:14:36.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/nova-base.yaml', 'puppet/services/nova-compute.yaml'], 'message': "WIP - DON'T MERGE: Add option for deploying ssh keys to nova users

Features like offline block migration require ssh keys deployed to
the nova users on all nodes, so these users can log into other nodes
without password.  This change creates and deploys an ssh key pair to
all nova nodes and adds a parameter to opt-out of this behaviour.

Change-Id: Ibe34e32b6010a187ffae08c4fdeb612ae8ac90fc
"}]
commit_message:
WIP - DON'T MERGE: Add option for deploying ssh keys to nova users

Features like offline block migration require ssh keys deployed to
the nova users on all nodes, so these users can log into other nodes
without password.  This change creates and deploys an ssh key pair to
all nova nodes and adds a parameter to opt-out of this behaviour.

Change-Id: Ibe34e32b6010a187ffae08c4fdeb612ae8ac90fc

subject: Remove linebreak from translatable string
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-16 10:12:25.000000000', 'files': ['src/js/components/nodes/NodesToolbar/NodesToolbarActions.js'], 'message': 'Remove linebreak from translatable string

The new line was breaking the translation jobs, as it gets copied as is
into the pot file. In general, it's better to use "+"-style
concatenation for translatable/user-facing strings, as otherwise the
unnecessary spaces from the indentation also get included in the string
to translate, which can be confusing to translators.

Change-Id: I49ba048e1b06199c54b93f2b14ce07b5acdf131d
Closes-Bug: #1691006
'}]
commit_message:
Remove linebreak from translatable string

The new line was breaking the translation jobs, as it gets copied as is
into the pot file. In general, it's better to use "+"-style
concatenation for translatable/user-facing strings, as otherwise the
unnecessary spaces from the indentation also get included in the string
to translate, which can be confusing to translators.

Change-Id: I49ba048e1b06199c54b93f2b14ce07b5acdf131d
Closes-Bug: #1691006

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-06 18:56:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/volume/cinder.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1554631.py'], 'message': 'Catching OverQuota Exception

When any vm creation fails because of exceeding 'gigabytes',
'volumes', 'per_volume_gigabytes' quotas, the error message
generated is specific to 'volumes' quota which says
"Volume resource quota exceeded". Instead, the error message
should be specific to the quota which failed.

Change-Id: I9c1ac2cd4752d5aac20d06407792647b4549ad3d
Closes-Bug: 1680457
(cherry picked from commit 510371d526bd45195be806fb153646abdc269b70)
'}]
commit_message:
Catching OverQuota Exception

When any vm creation fails because of exceeding 'gigabytes',
'volumes', 'per_volume_gigabytes' quotas, the error message
generated is specific to 'volumes' quota which says
"Volume resource quota exceeded". Instead, the error message
should be specific to the quota which failed.

Change-Id: I9c1ac2cd4752d5aac20d06407792647b4549ad3d
Closes-Bug: 1680457
(cherry picked from commit 510371d526bd45195be806fb153646abdc269b70)

subject: Lower pins for apt and concat
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-15 23:40:22.000000000', 'files': ['external_modules.txt'], 'message': "Lower pins for apt and concat

Version 3.0.0 of apt and concat have a requirement of puppet 4.7 which
is greater than our minmum supported versions. So for now let's pin
these to older versions until we can bump our minimums.

Change-Id: I156b8f3b40501b0191f317a8d36cbba99d172965
"}]
commit_message:
Lower pins for apt and concat

Version 3.0.0 of apt and concat have a requirement of puppet 4.7 which
is greater than our minmum supported versions. So for now let's pin
these to older versions until we can bump our minimums.

Change-Id: I156b8f3b40501b0191f317a8d36cbba99d172965

commit_message:
api-ref: Fix examples for add/removeFixedIp action

The nova-network has been deprecated since Newton.
In neutron case, a network ID is a UUID.
So replace an integer network ID with a UUID
in the addFixedIp action example.

The format of removeFixedIp action example
is fixed.

Change-Id: Icaaf25e7648a75b66f6fcaddd759fdf243810db4
Implements: blueprint api-ref-in-rst-pike

subject: Merge test_snapshot_create_with_volume_in_use
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-12 08:25:35.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_snapshots.py'], 'message': 'Merge test_snapshot_create_with_volume_in_use

test_snapshot_create_with_volume_in_use can be mostly
covered in test_snapshot_delete_with_volume_in_use, except
"Snapshot a volume which attached to an instance with
 force=False", so this is to move that test step to
test_snapshot_delete_with_volume_in_use and remove
test_snapshot_create_with_volume_in_use, so the total
run time can be reduced.

These two testcases are not used in the newest defcore
json files.

Change-Id: Ib04fe2d2127681cd89bfea3cc2d09f4aafbc6f34
'}]
commit_message:
Merge test_snapshot_create_with_volume_in_use

test_snapshot_create_with_volume_in_use can be mostly
covered in test_snapshot_delete_with_volume_in_use, except
"Snapshot a volume which attached to an instance with
 force=False", so this is to move that test step to
test_snapshot_delete_with_volume_in_use and remove
test_snapshot_create_with_volume_in_use, so the total
run time can be reduced.

These two testcases are not used in the newest defcore
json files.

Change-Id: Ib04fe2d2127681cd89bfea3cc2d09f4aafbc6f34

subject: Add System Processor/Memory info
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-05-10 10:51:10.000000000', 'files': ['sushy/resources/system/constants.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/json_samples/processor_collection.json', 'sushy/resources/system/system.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/json_samples/processor.json', 'sushy/tests/unit/resources/system/test_system.py', 'doc/source/usage.rst', 'sushy/resources/system/processor.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/resources/system/test_processor.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/json_samples/system.json', 'sushy/tests/unit/json_samples/processor2.json', 'sushy/resources/system/mappings.py'], 'message': 'Add System Processor/Memory info

This patch adds 2 new attributes to System:

  memory_summary: <type: namedtuple>
    The memory of the system in general detail. It is a
    namedtuple containing the following:

      `size_gib`: The size of memory of the system in GiB
      `health`: The overall health state of memory.

  processor_summary: <type: namedtuple>
    The processors of the system in general detail. It is a
    namedtuple containing the following:

      `count`: The number of processors in the system. To be
               precise, it is number of logical CPUs (threads).
      `architecture`: The architecture of the processor/s.

This processor and memory information will be directly consumed
by ironic inspection.

Change-Id: I19acd74e26a861147df747f3d3f34852decf5403
'}]
commit_message:
Add System Processor/Memory info

This patch adds 2 new attributes to System:

  memory_summary: <type: namedtuple>
    The memory of the system in general detail. It is a
    namedtuple containing the following:

      `size_gib`: The size of memory of the system in GiB
      `health`: The overall health state of memory.

  processor_summary: <type: namedtuple>
    The processors of the system in general detail. It is a
    namedtuple containing the following:

      `count`: The number of processors in the system. To be
               precise, it is number of logical CPUs (threads).
      `architecture`: The architecture of the processor/s.

This processor and memory information will be directly consumed
by ironic inspection.

Change-Id: I19acd74e26a861147df747f3d3f34852decf5403

agent: ARP responder cleanups

The code doing ARP responder installation can be cleaned-up
and improved a bit now that I289d546780f10dc1002ab6bc2e1b38c9ef2d728f

this bagpipe agent code and the base agent ARP responder code.

subject: Allow timeout in active states
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-10 13:15:45.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/test/unit/test_node_cache.py', 'releasenotes/notes/active_states_timeout-3e3ab110870483ec.yaml', 'doc/source/images/states.svg', 'ironic_inspector/introspection_state.py'], 'message': 'Allow timeout in active states

While reviewing the API--Worker split spec we discussed the issues
following from selecting oslo.messaging as the queue implementation.
Because of the at-most-once semantics of oslo.messaging it may well happen
that a task will end up hanging indefinitelly in an active state.

This change allows the node_cache.clean_up() function to pick-up these
"tasks" and "terminate" them by setting the error state.

Change-Id: I696f14d486f10d84aaae5675446138ebdd047ecd
Depends-On: Iaeb99ab1954a1d5303c9bd10b81f7f8d6aa7e731
'}]
commit_message:
Allow timeout in active states

While reviewing the API--Worker split spec we discussed the issues
following from selecting oslo.messaging as the queue implementation.
Because of the at-most-once semantics of oslo.messaging it may well happen
that a task will end up hanging indefinitelly in an active state.

This change allows the node_cache.clean_up() function to pick-up these
"tasks" and "terminate" them by setting the error state.

Change-Id: I696f14d486f10d84aaae5675446138ebdd047ecd
Depends-On: Iaeb99ab1954a1d5303c9bd10b81f7f8d6aa7e731

subject: Correct invalid client in ServersNegativeTestMultiTenantJSON
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-09 08:22:26.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_servers_negative.py'], 'message': 'Correct invalid client in ServersNegativeTestMultiTenantJSON

In ServersNegativeTestMultiTenantJSON's setUp, self.client
should be self.servers_client, otherwise we will get:
<AttributeError: "'ServersNegativeTestMultiTenantJSON' object
has no attribute 'client'">, and so we will encounter twice
unnecessary rebuild_server.

Change-Id: Ie5559bd4f1cbbb0b128946c21bd737585f79ffad
'}]
commit_message:
Correct invalid client in ServersNegativeTestMultiTenantJSON

In ServersNegativeTestMultiTenantJSON's setUp, self.client
should be self.servers_client, otherwise we will get:
<AttributeError: "'ServersNegativeTestMultiTenantJSON' object
has no attribute 'client'">, and so we will encounter twice
unnecessary rebuild_server.

Change-Id: Ie5559bd4f1cbbb0b128946c21bd737585f79ffad

is to add a simple test case for this new feature.

Including:

[1] Add v3 volumes_client as library
[2] Add show volume summary api to v3 volumes_client
[3] Add unit tests for show volume summary api
[4] Add test case: test_show_volume_summary
[5] Add release note

Change-Id: I9904bc53896e7d58a22aef11f6a3128147c0a373
'}]
commit_message:
Add test case for show volume summary

Show volume summary is a new api implemented in volume v3. This patch
is to add a simple test case for this new feature.

Including:

[1] Add v3 volumes_client as library
[2] Add show volume summary api to v3 volumes_client
[3] Add unit tests for show volume summary api
[4] Add test case: test_show_volume_summary
[5] Add release note

Change-Id: I9904bc53896e7d58a22aef11f6a3128147c0a373

commit_message:
Fix for implied roles test

API check_role_inference_rule in roles_client only tested in
test_roles_client.py, but there is not api test for it. Also,
API show_role_inference_rule is called in api tests, but the
content of show_role_inference_rule has never been checked.
This patch is to provide tests for these two APIs.

Change-Id: I0b388e8f0149f5e721c920610d66057a1612cccd

When we support multi-attach volumes, for volume drivers which must
make host state changes (eg mount/unmount) it is no longer enough to
know only which volume is being connected; we must also know which
instance it is being attached to. Consider the following sequence of
calls, and the expected behaviour of the volume driver:

 * connect_volume(conn_info)
     connect the volume
 * connect_volume(conn_info)
     do nothing (volume is already connected)
 * disconnect_volume(conn_info)
     disconnect the volume
 * disconnect_volume(conn_info)
     do nothing (volume is already disconnected)

Now consider these were actually connections to different instances:

 * connect_volume(conn_info, A)
     connect the volume
 * connect_volume(conn_info, B)

 * disconnect_volume(conn_info, A)

 * disconnect_volume(conn_info, B)
     disconnect the volume

behaviour unless it also knows which instance is being attached.

This is a non functional change which simply adds instance as an
argument to all connect_volume and disconnect_volume calls in libvirt
volume drivers. It is effectively a part of change I3155984d. I have
split it as it is mechanical, it touches a large number of files
which make the substantive change harder to read, and to isolate the
substantive change from merge conflicts caused by this change.

We also add a utility test class: SubclassSignatureTestCase. This is
used in this patch to ensure we have found all connect_volume and
disconnect_volume methods which need to be updated. We implement it in
the top level tests module as we expect it to be useful elsewhere.

This patch was previously submitted as change I658d7ab5 but had to be
reverted as it failed to update the signatures of several volume
drivers. This is also what has prompted the addition of
SubclassSignatureTestCase, which ensures this hasn't happened again.

commit_message:
libvirt: Pass instance to connect_volume and disconnect_volume

When we support multi-attach volumes, for volume drivers which must
make host state changes (eg mount/unmount) it is no longer enough to
know only which volume is being connected; we must also know which
instance it is being attached to. Consider the following sequence of
calls, and the expected behaviour of the volume driver:

 * connect_volume(conn_info)
     connect the volume
 * connect_volume(conn_info)
     do nothing (volume is already connected)
 * disconnect_volume(conn_info)
     disconnect the volume
 * disconnect_volume(conn_info)
     do nothing (volume is already disconnected)

Now consider these were actually connections to different instances:

 * connect_volume(conn_info, A)
     connect the volume
 * connect_volume(conn_info, B)
     do nothing (volume is already connected)
 * disconnect_volume(conn_info, A)
     ++ do nothing (volume is still connected to B)
 * disconnect_volume(conn_info, B)
     disconnect the volume

IOW, it is not possible for the driver to determine the correct
behaviour unless it also knows which instance is being attached.

This is a non functional change which simply adds instance as an
argument to all connect_volume and disconnect_volume calls in libvirt
volume drivers. It is effectively a part of change I3155984d. I have
split it as it is mechanical, it touches a large number of files
which make the substantive change harder to read, and to isolate the
substantive change from merge conflicts caused by this change.

We also add a utility test class: SubclassSignatureTestCase. This is
used in this patch to ensure we have found all connect_volume and
disconnect_volume methods which need to be updated. We implement it in
the top level tests module as we expect it to be useful elsewhere.

This patch was previously submitted as change I658d7ab5 but had to be
reverted as it failed to update the signatures of several volume
drivers. This is also what has prompted the addition of
SubclassSignatureTestCase, which ensures this hasn't happened again.

Change-Id: I01c908add1312063f0db724110f7e5927ff281ff

commit_message:
fix InvalidSharedStorage exception message

The exception message for InvalidSharedStorage is grammatically
complex and ignores the possibility of block migration, which
results in a misleading and confusing message for the user.

Change it to something simpler and more accurate.

Change-Id: Icfc8e151a4ea36ec303f0b8c2e1dc9e6f0bd5925
Closes-Bug: #1690890

commit_message:
Remove all calls to network interface via Nova

Nova team removed all network interface from novaclient, forces to use
neutronclient. That is why we need to remove a bunch of scenarios and
utils.

Change-Id: Idafbdedaf01c9ed77cf5ec269b0ccf0c90183566

subject: Remove domain part from fqdn_<network> name.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-15 18:18:19.000000000', 'files': ['lib/facter/alt_fqdns.rb'], 'message': 'Remove domain part from fqdn_<network> name.

If an user set CloudDomain after initial deployment then the
/etc/hosts will be filled with the new domain while the node will
still have the domain set by whatever was in dhcp_domain on the
undercloud.

This poses problem in all places where ::fqdn_$NETWORK is use in THT.
Removing the domain part here solves as we don't depends on the domain
anymore.

It may be argued that it's not the "fqdn" anymore, so maybe more work
is necessary and create a alt_dns.rb fact with proper adjustment of
the THT.

Change-Id: Ic9d8a791d19eb5db7438793446113d93cc176d4b
Related-Bug: #1581472
'}]
commit_message:
Remove domain part from fqdn_<network> name.

If an user set CloudDomain after initial deployment then the
/etc/hosts will be filled with the new domain while the node will
still have the domain set by whatever was in dhcp_domain on the
undercloud.

This poses problem in all places where ::fqdn_$NETWORK is use in THT.
Removing the domain part here solves as we don't depends on the domain
anymore.

It may be argued that it's not the "fqdn" anymore, so maybe more work
is necessary and create a alt_dns.rb fact with proper adjustment of
the THT.

Change-Id: Ic9d8a791d19eb5db7438793446113d93cc176d4b
Related-Bug: #1581472

subject: Isolate ansible-runtime venv site packages
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-05-14 15:41:17.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh', 'playbooks/inventory/host_vars/localhost.yml'], 'message': 'Isolate ansible-runtime venv site packages

In the isolated ansible-runtime venv, we were inheriting the system
site packages inside the virtualenv. This breaks the openstack-ansible
wrapper because it always assumes that ansible is installed in the
ansible-runtime venv. When ansible is already installed on the system,
pip does not reinstall it in the venv because it is inherited from
the system, so the wrapper fails.

This fix also includes a PATH entry in the openstack-ansible wrapper
which will make the wrapper more resilient against bugs like this
in the future.

Change-Id: Ifa5234cf7353f1443c5b77787363d8880b5cf0b6
Closes-Bug: #1690447
'}]
commit_message:
Isolate ansible-runtime venv site packages

In the isolated ansible-runtime venv, we were inheriting the system
site packages inside the virtualenv. This breaks the openstack-ansible
wrapper because it always assumes that ansible is installed in the
ansible-runtime venv. When ansible is already installed on the system,
pip does not reinstall it in the venv because it is inherited from
the system, so the wrapper fails.

This fix also includes a PATH entry in the openstack-ansible wrapper
which will make the wrapper more resilient against bugs like this
in the future.

Change-Id: Ifa5234cf7353f1443c5b77787363d8880b5cf0b6
Closes-Bug: #1690447

commit_message:
Fix working with requests Session object

Creating a session per request does not make much sense - we're not using
its benefits like connection pooling. This change creates a session
per connector. Also correct sending Content-Type header without content.

Change-Id: I597ada4582865d62f8559aef212ff79c7ddf6863

commit_message:
Improve logging and error handling in base code

* Create more specific error classes and move their handling
  into one place; remove HTTP 404 handling from BaseResource
* Parse error response as defined in the spec (section 6.5.6)
* More formal log messages for requests and responses
* Clarify which request returned the reported response code
* Log received resource representation and members count
* Fix several typos in the tests

Change-Id: Ia288608f1cf11b312d45cc798d417ecd6efefb35

subject: Provide facility for a complete file override
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2017-02-23 21:11:29.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/gnocchi_post_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/gnocchi-deploy-config-file-afba6c2a8edac025.yaml'], 'message': 'Provide facility for a complete file override

Instead of forcing the use of config_override, this patch
provides a facility where the deployer can place a file
in /etc/openstack_deploy on the deployment host. The file
will be interpreted through the template engine (allowing
jinja to be used in the file) and placed on the target host.

If the file is not found, the fallback will be the default

The patch also ensures that the curl is silent and therefore

Change-Id: Ieab7eab7f902741e62e1d2a49191010f8fd38442
'}]
commit_message:
Provide facility for a complete file override

Instead of forcing the use of config_override, this patch
provides a facility where the deployer can place a file
in /etc/openstack_deploy on the deployment host. The file
will be interpreted through the template engine (allowing
jinja to be used in the file) and placed on the target host.

If the file is not found, the fallback will be the default
file in the git source.

The patch also ensures that the curl is silent and therefore
does not show the download progress bar on the deployment
host when it executes.

Change-Id: Ieab7eab7f902741e62e1d2a49191010f8fd38442

subject: Fixes missing agent_state issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-25 07:28:05.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/tests/unit/neutron/test_hyperv_neutron_agent.py', 'hyperv/neutron/l2_agent.py', 'hyperv/neutron/hyperv_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "Fixes missing agent_state issue

HyperVNeutronAgent's _set_agent_state method depends on the fact that
_physical_network_mappings has already been set by the parent's class
init. The parent's class init depends on properties set in the
HyperVNeutronAgent's init.

Also, _setup_rpc will create the heartbeat daemon before the agent_state
is even initialized, which can cause the heartbeat to fail.

This patch simplifies the initialization process.

Closes-Bug: #1651408

Change-Id: Ibf11986b84efb0f015b5507a6df452606bf097c7
(cherry picked from commit b15a3dacf3a5e24c24ab9e806fd2d5d2634d3735)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes missing agent_state issue

HyperVNeutronAgent's _set_agent_state method depends on the fact that
_physical_network_mappings has already been set by the parent's class
init. The parent's class init depends on properties set in the
HyperVNeutronAgent's init.

Also, _setup_rpc will create the heartbeat daemon before the agent_state
is even initialized, which can cause the heartbeat to fail.

This patch simplifies the initialization process.

Closes-Bug: #1651408

Change-Id: Ibf11986b84efb0f015b5507a6df452606bf097c7
(cherry picked from commit b15a3dacf3a5e24c24ab9e806fd2d5d2634d3735)

subject: Ensure instance files are deleted when using multiple CSVs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-03 06:27:47.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/vmops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_vmops.py'], 'message': "Ensure instance files are deleted when using multiple CSVs

When using multiple CSVs, we rely on the instance itself when
locating its files.

The issue is that we're fetching the instance files location after
destroying the instance, for which reason we're leaking instance
files.

Closes-Bug: #1633556

Conflicts:
        hyperv/nova/vmops.py
        hyperv/tests/unit/test_vmops.py

Change-Id: Ic09ad9e8346a69b74d6f930ee0756f511d0c3ac6
(cherry picked from commit 90a08935edabbbe0d28583eefa23e6e78efde2de)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure instance files are deleted when using multiple CSVs

When using multiple CSVs, we rely on the instance itself when
locating its files.

The issue is that we're fetching the instance files location after
destroying the instance, for which reason we're leaking instance
files.

Closes-Bug: #1633556

Conflicts:
        hyperv/nova/vmops.py
        hyperv/tests/unit/test_vmops.py

Change-Id: Ic09ad9e8346a69b74d6f930ee0756f511d0c3ac6
(cherry picked from commit 90a08935edabbbe0d28583eefa23e6e78efde2de)

commit_message:
Fixes unit tests

Latest releases of oslo.config enforces the config options'
types. In a few unit tests, some config options are overriden
with sentinels, which breaks the unit tests, using the latest
oslo.config release.

This patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: I6d7ecf339ba5294a45f342d19e34e8865cb9f2cc

[{'number': 19, 'created': '2017-05-16 05:51:58.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/rpm-distro/finalise.d/90-selinux-fixfiles-restore', 'diskimage_builder/lib/disk-image-create', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/blockdevice.py'], 'message': 'Apply setfiles on all mountpoints

With new block device definition, where content of the image
can be mounted on different partitions, is not enough with
executing setfiles on root directory. Instead of that, expose
all the mountpoints on the image, and apply setfiles on them.

Change-Id: I153f979722eaec49eab93d7cd398c5589b9bfc44
'}]
commit_message:
Apply setfiles on all mountpoints

With new block device definition, where content of the image
can be mounted on different partitions, is not enough with
executing setfiles on root directory. Instead of that, expose
all the mountpoints on the image, and apply setfiles on them.

Change-Id: I153f979722eaec49eab93d7cd398c5589b9bfc44

commit_message:
Fix permission on chrony.conf

Chrony drops root to user 'chrony' on startup, so it's config file
should be owned by user this user.

Change-Id: I8ba976cc685d2e50e09211f67507487a1e0e3c5f

Using "{{ item }}" is causing wrong fact assignment
and tries to check port when containers are running.

Fixed Ceilometer and Heat SWARM tests

because we shouldn't hardcode count of processes in
automated tests.

Closes-Bug: #1529072

commit_message:
fuel-qa to use mos-updates instead of mos-playbooks

We have deprecated mos-playbooks package in favour of
mos-updates package. On the other hand, fuel-qa code
still uses mos-playbooks.

Change-Id: I8abc486d326533f8a5bd2291365b6414c962c689
Closes-bug: #1690389

Fixed an action definition for tempest tests.

TODO: Add release note.

Change-Id: I0b582e9f81ab72cd05f4fae592c568f38dec6e00

commit_message:
Add "action_region" param for OpenStack actions

A new config item 'modules-support-region' is introduced to be used by
cloud operators, mistral will decide if add 'action_region' param to
openstack service action inputs according to that config.

Fixed an action definition for tempest tests.

TODO: Add release note.

Implements: blueprint mistral-multi-region-support

Change-Id: I0b582e9f81ab72cd05f4fae592c568f38dec6e00

* monasca-collector -h

commit_message:
Fix broken help commands for monasca-*

Call for:

* monasca-collector -h
* monasca-forwader -h
* monasca-statsd -h

was broken, as described in [1].

Commits removes usage of deprecated optparse in favor
of argparse.

Ref:

Story: 2000998
Task: 4180

commit_message:
notification: Remove eventlet timers

This change removes usage of eventlet timers.

This allows coordinator heartbeat/watchers to work correctly when
the main thread is stuck for any reason (IO, time.sleep, ...).

Change-Id: I847aebb0d0166c2b46505061a15a06e3ce1b5eb2
Closes-Bug: #1566887

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-08 13:48:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/test_ovs_bridge.py'], 'message': 'Fix TypeError in native of_interface _get_dpid

If no bridge datapath_id was returned for some
reason (like broken deployment), _get_dpid()
would process further and raise TypeError while
trying to use int conversion on an empty list.
This patch addresses the problem by raising a
RuntimeError if no datapath was found for a
bridge.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py

Closes-Bug: #1615690

Change-Id: Ie97540793e5d2b14120d3f1bafbf659427c44117
(cherry picked from commit 59d29f7cda8976c2a360b0c844df825a101661ee)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError in native of_interface _get_dpid

If no bridge datapath_id was returned for some
reason (like broken deployment), _get_dpid()
would process further and raise TypeError while
trying to use int conversion on an empty list.
This patch addresses the problem by raising a
RuntimeError if no datapath was found for a
bridge.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py

Closes-Bug: #1615690

Change-Id: Ie97540793e5d2b14120d3f1bafbf659427c44117
(cherry picked from commit 59d29f7cda8976c2a360b0c844df825a101661ee)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-05-10 14:35:41.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove redundant OVB jobs from tripleo-ci repo

There are bunch of jobs that have no value anymore,
removing them from experimental queue.
  - ovb-tempest job uses old code base and old tempest version,
which makes it completely irrelevant for all repos
  - ovb-ipv6 job functionality is covered in ovb-updates job
  - promote-* jobs are not used in tripleo-ci at all

Change-Id: If7591676a099ad2d83dcf02c74c36759ae55d4f6
'}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant OVB jobs from tripleo-ci repo

There are bunch of jobs that have no value anymore,
removing them from experimental queue.
  - ovb-tempest job uses old code base and old tempest version,
which makes it completely irrelevant for all repos
  - ovb-ipv6 job functionality is covered in ovb-updates job
  - promote-* jobs are not used in tripleo-ci at all

Change-Id: If7591676a099ad2d83dcf02c74c36759ae55d4f6

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I376b2140d7fa9520d976c213bd12dc814c6cf532
(cherry picked from commit 161a0adbe7ee89e44b1781ae23f2788e964343f7)

commit_message:
Remove log translations in python-keystoneclient

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: Ia77819cbb133903d20e821bff0c45766b11ef07b

commit_message:
Fix setting of node and node_private

We should be writing new /etc/nodepool/node and
/etc/nodepool/node_private files on each iteration of the loop through
the subnodes instead of appending to the file that is already there.

Change-Id: If70579cee88ba1a0c8712e8f1625467f75313fa1

commit_message:
Stop dstat at the end of a job

We should stop the dstat process that was previously started in
toci_gate_test.sh, so that processes aren't left running from tripleo-ci
jobs.

Change-Id: I200fe5f99d371fdde3b20518ffd10197680d46dd

commit_message:
Add generated nodepool key to authorized_keys

Add the generated nodepool key to the authorized_keys for the local
user. This is needed when running locally with
toci_instack_oooq_multinode.sh as it needs to ssh using this key to the
localhost.

subject: Add support for $DO_BOOTSTRAP_SUBNODES
revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2017-05-15 13:46:20.000000000', 'files': ['toci_instack_osinfra.sh', 'toci_gate_test-oooq.sh', 'toci_gate_test-orig.sh'], 'message': 'Add support for $DO_BOOTSTRAP_SUBNODES

Add a new environment variable $DO_BOOTSTRAP_SUBNODES that can be used
to control whether or not the subnodes are bootstrapped. It defaults to
1, and can be set to 0 to stop the bootstrap from running. This can save
a lot of time when iteratively running locally and the subnodes have
already been bootstrapped.

Change-Id: I4b21d6d30ab9d7babd3810ab558ec43378ad808e
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for $DO_BOOTSTRAP_SUBNODES

Add a new environment variable $DO_BOOTSTRAP_SUBNODES that can be used
to control whether or not the subnodes are bootstrapped. It defaults to
1, and can be set to 0 to stop the bootstrap from running. This can save
a lot of time when iteratively running locally and the subnodes have
already been bootstrapped.

Change-Id: I4b21d6d30ab9d7babd3810ab558ec43378ad808e

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I376b2140d7fa9520d976c213bd12dc814c6cf532

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-28 08:23:03.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v3/parameters.yaml'], 'message': 'Add filter explain in api ref about parents_as_list and subtree_as_list

I create a project and its child, then show the project with subtree_as_list,
but the subtree list in response is null.
I can not find problem via api ref about this parameter, until reading code about
subtree_as_list. The subtree list will be filtered against the projects this
user has access to. So the filter explain should add to the api ref.

Change-Id: If5c1c8dff05c81be180d5d4858fadf9ce7051ef8
'}]
commit_message:
Add filter explain in api ref about parents_as_list and subtree_as_list

I create a project and its child, then show the project with subtree_as_list,
but the subtree list in response is null.
I can not find problem via api ref about this parameter, until reading code about
subtree_as_list. The subtree list will be filtered against the projects this
user has access to. So the filter explain should add to the api ref.

Change-Id: If5c1c8dff05c81be180d5d4858fadf9ce7051ef8

Refresh test environments

This patch refreshes py27 environment setup and add py35 to envlist.
To fix errors in py35 test, use reverse instead reverse_lazy.
Also, remove run_tests.sh that is no longer used.

This will actually apply default_log_levels as specified in the file.
(which will make tests to log debug messages for neutron.* namespace in
addition to warnings.)

The change also required a change in daemon.py to pull in root logger
using stdlib logging module instead of oslo.log, so that the
test_unwatch_log test case doesn't fail when oslo.log is actually

Change-Id: I7dc8cf258e314e3b0e8c7faec6fbe0db3f5c318c
"}]
commit_message:
Set up logging according to neutron.conf file passed

This will actually apply default_log_levels as specified in the file.
(which will make tests to log debug messages for neutron.* namespace in
addition to warnings.)

The change also required a change in daemon.py to pull in root logger
using stdlib logging module instead of oslo.log, so that the
test_unwatch_log test case doesn't fail when oslo.log is actually
initialized using logging.setup().

Change-Id: I7dc8cf258e314e3b0e8c7faec6fbe0db3f5c318c

subject: Fix V3ADFSPassword retrieval of scoped token
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-07 21:40:37.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/extras/_saml2/v3/adfs.py'], 'message': 'Fix V3ADFSPassword retrieval of scoped token

The current V3ADFSPassword plugin is unable to return a scoped token in
“access.create(resp=self.authenticated_response)” due to scoping info
not being passed from V3ADFSPassword to the parent class.

This change adds kwargs when calling the parent class’ init method
(as performed by other plugins) to ensure the scoping info is correctly
propagated.

Change-Id: I825f7fe8f6d062ca23623ca5d6790a1dd45a0f5a
Closes-Bug: #1687316
'}]
commit_message:
Fix V3ADFSPassword retrieval of scoped token

The current V3ADFSPassword plugin is unable to return a scoped token in
“access.create(resp=self.authenticated_response)” due to scoping info
not being passed from V3ADFSPassword to the parent class.

This change adds kwargs when calling the parent class’ init method
(as performed by other plugins) to ensure the scoping info is correctly
propagated.

Change-Id: I825f7fe8f6d062ca23623ca5d6790a1dd45a0f5a
Closes-Bug: #1687316

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-15 19:29:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/audit/test_audit_oslo_messaging.py'], 'message': 'Update driver config parameter from string to list

This patch set fixes a gating issue where the parameter passes
into [oslo_messaging_notifications] driver is a string rather
than a list.  This causes the code to enumerate over the string
when [audit_middleware_notifications] driver is set to None.  Per
[0], that parameter should be a list instead of a string.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/notify/notifier.py#L35

Change-Id: Iab92629b19f46aa3bff96aa6a22b5a609a4ff76e
'}]
commit_message:
Update driver config parameter from string to list

This patch set fixes a gating issue where the parameter passes
into [oslo_messaging_notifications] driver is a string rather
than a list.  This causes the code to enumerate over the string
when [audit_middleware_notifications] driver is set to None.  Per
[0], that parameter should be a list instead of a string.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/notify/notifier.py#L35

Change-Id: Iab92629b19f46aa3bff96aa6a22b5a609a4ff76e

commit_message:
Remove translation of log messages from ironic/drivers

Folders:
    + ironic/drivers/modules/ (not include sub-folder)
    + ironic/drivers/ (not include sub-folder)

i18n team has decided not to translate the logs because it seems
like it's not very useful

Change-Id: If039397934b35ba1b60a176911d1024478731658
Closes-Bug: #1674374

subject: Execute ssl-dns-setup task on all pre-defined tags
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17737, 'name': 'Fuel DevOps Robot', 'email': 'devops+scripts@mirantis.net', 'username': 'fueldevopsrobot'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-23 09:19:26.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/ssl/tasks.yaml'], 'message': 'Execute ssl-dns-setup task on all pre-defined tags

As we have pre-defined tags inside fuel we should ensure
that all of tags are able to be deployed properly.
ssl-dns-setup task was skipped for all non-controller tags which
leads to not configured dns server on these nodes (and as result -
failed upload_cirros task).

Change-Id: I045bb7e709d6e18e2beb934b42094cbb4bc61f00
Closes-bug: 1665353
(cherry picked from commit 22d5c26b3b48fd051c553b0d2b55b9d28d96e0d1)
'}]
commit_message:
Execute ssl-dns-setup task on all pre-defined tags

As we have pre-defined tags inside fuel we should ensure
that all of tags are able to be deployed properly.
ssl-dns-setup task was skipped for all non-controller tags which
leads to not configured dns server on these nodes (and as result -
failed upload_cirros task).

Change-Id: I045bb7e709d6e18e2beb934b42094cbb4bc61f00
Closes-bug: 1665353
(cherry picked from commit 22d5c26b3b48fd051c553b0d2b55b9d28d96e0d1)

commit_message:
Run containers job on each patch of tripleo repos

It's pretty important to see containers job failures when we
change something in CI code.
It's pretty stable to have it running for every patch
(non voting for now).

Change-Id: Iccdacbe61ad6f14b991f4aa210baa3304e446384

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-08 18:25:04.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/barbican.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Create new Barbican gates that have removed unused services

For the barbcan functional tests, most of the core
services such as Cinder and Nova are not needed.
Hopefully we can remove them and speed up the gates.
This change adds them as experimental checks. If they succeed, we can
promote these to be the main gates and remove the existing ones.

commit_message:
Create new Barbican gates that have removed unused services

For the barbcan functional tests, most of the core
services such as Cinder and Nova are not needed.
Hopefully we can remove them and speed up the gates.
This change adds them as experimental checks. If they succeed, we can
promote these to be the main gates and remove the existing ones.

Change-Id: I68810330dbee4033f8198f39aba5b75cd3357399

commit_message:
Add VLAN aware VMs support

1. What is the problem
Tricircle does not support VLAN aware VMs

2. What is the solution to the problem
Add VLAN aware VMs support

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
Add VLAN aware VMs support

Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vm-support
Change-Id: Ieed7ead2be3b152228fd11c454f2db1b640820c2

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-11 11:32:04.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/tempest-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Fixed the path of generate-tempest-plugins-list.py

* since on using zuul-git-prep, openstack/tempest is
  the current $workspace and earlier we were using the
  wrong path which leds to failure of excution of above
  script and further steps using that path. Fixing the
  workspace path fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I9f5b3190adfb60a639b10cbbf706369b2d18c48c
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed the path of generate-tempest-plugins-list.py

* since on using zuul-git-prep, openstack/tempest is
  the current $workspace and earlier we were using the
  wrong path which leds to failure of excution of above
  script and further steps using that path. Fixing the
  workspace path fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I9f5b3190adfb60a639b10cbbf706369b2d18c48c

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I193a30d77485db5e3a08cd68552c968a66a45868

subject: VMAX driver - Rollback error on Live Migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-04 10:27:45.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/masking.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/test_vmax.py'], 'message': 'VMAX driver - Rollback error on Live Migration

This patch fixes an issue where errorMessage is not getting reassigned
from None in the method ._get_port_group_name_from_mv., having the knock
on effect where errors are not being picked up in subsequent calls or
conditional checks.

Change-Id: I74a85aaa912a7f4c22abbf48f0a5d1bd4538c098
Closes-Bug: #1686174
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Rollback error on Live Migration

This patch fixes an issue where errorMessage is not getting reassigned
from None in the method ._get_port_group_name_from_mv., having the knock
on effect where errors are not being picked up in subsequent calls or
conditional checks.

Change-Id: I74a85aaa912a7f4c22abbf48f0a5d1bd4538c098
Closes-Bug: #1686174

commit_message:
XenAPI: use os-xenapi for XenAPI driver

os-xenapi contains all XenServer dom0 plugins and provide utility
tools for communicating to XenServer dom0 plugins, currently both
nova and neutron projects are using os-xenapi. This patch is to
change ceilometer to use os-xenapi too.

Change-Id: I14819fd57305edb0f4337af88e56ed6b980d7da8

commit_message:
Optimize the case of versioned image endpoint in catalog

We have version discovery for glance. However, if someone asks for a
version, and it's the version that they get from the catalog, we can
skip doing a full discovery run. Do that.

Change-Id: I2c0694ffc70bf2801de1fc187ba7b38e6a1b9d09

subject: Fix broken version discovery endpoints
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-15 22:18:28.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/fixtures/image-version-broken.json', 'shade/tests/unit/test_image.py', 'shade/tests/unit/base.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Fix broken version discovery endpoints

In the version discovery spec, it is noted that both schema and netloc
on endpoints reported by version discovery documents are known to be
able to be broken, but shade was only fixing scheme. Update the code to
do the right thing. Also, add a test to ensure that this behavior occurs
correctly. While we're in the tests for this, have the discovery call
return a 300, which is what it returns. There are no bugs in this area,
but 300 is correct so we should test it that way.

Story: 2001027
Change-Id: Id04f6f033c9277e791b602f193d1eaf6ac73047f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix broken version discovery endpoints

In the version discovery spec, it is noted that both schema and netloc
on endpoints reported by version discovery documents are known to be
able to be broken, but shade was only fixing scheme. Update the code to
do the right thing. Also, add a test to ensure that this behavior occurs
correctly. While we're in the tests for this, have the discovery call
return a 300, which is what it returns. There are no bugs in this area,
but 300 is correct so we should test it that way.

Story: 2001027
Change-Id: Id04f6f033c9277e791b602f193d1eaf6ac73047f

subject: Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-11 09:48:33.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/swift_install.yml'], 'message': "Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: Ib0693f6ff28e2f9e9b2befbd1abc05945a7b6d61
(cherry picked from commit 14d1a2feb85bbe6c4b098ee825de487db3159efb)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: Ib0693f6ff28e2f9e9b2befbd1abc05945a7b6d61
(cherry picked from commit 14d1a2feb85bbe6c4b098ee825de487db3159efb)

subject: Fix tips jobs and convert Nova Floating IP calls
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2017-05-15 22:18:28.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/functional/test_floating_ip.py', 'shade/tests/functional/hooks/post_test_hook.sh', 'shade/_tasks.py', 'tox.ini', 'extras/install-tips.sh', 'shade/openstackcloud.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_nova.py'], 'message': "Fix tips jobs and convert Nova Floating IP calls

The script to install the git versions of the libraries wasn't working
because it wasn't installing over top of the versions already installed
by pip. So by adding an uninstall first, we ensure that the git version
is actually installed.

Also, add a pbr freeze to the end so that we can verify, and some +x so
that we can see the output of our scripts.

And: novaclient 8.0 doesn't have these calls anymore. However, the tests we
had on legacy clouds were erroneously installing the wrong version of
novaclient so we did not catch it. Doh. This has to do the tests and the
calls in the same patch because the fix to the gate job to install the
correct verison of the library exposed the fact that we had be broken
for these for a few minutes.

Depends-On: I208e8c009d0438de19cd3eb08dc45ddebb45d3e9
Change-Id: I4fd882aeb8373b94c7f6b54d97b457042b324361
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tips jobs and convert Nova Floating IP calls

The script to install the git versions of the libraries wasn't working
because it wasn't installing over top of the versions already installed
by pip. So by adding an uninstall first, we ensure that the git version
is actually installed.

Also, add a pbr freeze to the end so that we can verify, and some +x so
that we can see the output of our scripts.

And: novaclient 8.0 doesn't have these calls anymore. However, the tests we
had on legacy clouds were erroneously installing the wrong version of
novaclient so we did not catch it. Doh. This has to do the tests and the
calls in the same patch because the fix to the gate job to install the
correct verison of the library exposed the fact that we had be broken
for these for a few minutes.

Depends-On: I208e8c009d0438de19cd3eb08dc45ddebb45d3e9

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-12 10:54:32.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/cinder_backends.yml', 'tasks/cinder_qos.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/support-insecure-cinder-endpoint-5cbbb4d8c647d521.yaml'], 'message': 'Support no validation of internal SSL endpoints

commit_message:
Support no validation of internal SSL endpoints

If self-signed certificates are used for internal endpoints
the current implementation will fail as there is no option
to turn off the certificate validation.

This patch implements a new variable to do so.

Change-Id: I64a80716a8636ab978071e9e6c7aaa19962547ec

Update auto-addresses on MAC change

This adjusts the IPAM code to ensure that fixed IPs
on auto address subnets always get reprocessed so they
reflect MAC address changes.

Closes-Bug: #1671548

subject: Fix cinder backends detection for nova ceph deploy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-05 01:48:24.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml'], 'message': 'Fix cinder backends detection for nova ceph deploy

When nova is not rbd backed but cinder is using ceph, the ceph_client
role should run against compute hosts. There is a var that is supposed
to resolve to a boolean indicating whether rbd backends are in use
on cinder, but it was broken and resolved to a string instead, breaking
the ceph_client conditional for nova.

Change-Id: I9999c373f942d3565ab86815e8330a489a83d677
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder backends detection for nova ceph deploy

When nova is not rbd backed but cinder is using ceph, the ceph_client
role should run against compute hosts. There is a var that is supposed
to resolve to a boolean indicating whether rbd backends are in use
on cinder, but it was broken and resolved to a string instead, breaking
the ceph_client conditional for nova.

Change-Id: I9999c373f942d3565ab86815e8330a489a83d677

subject: Remove trailing slash in nginx config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-15 12:55:38.000000000', 'files': ['templates/nova-placement-nginx.conf.j2'], 'message': "Remove trailing slash in nginx config

The nginx configuration file passes along traffic to the placement
API if the URI is '/placement/' but the service is registered with
keystone as just '/placement' (no trailing slash). This causes
nginx to send back the default page when nova services try to talk
to the placement API.

This patch fixes the nginx configuration to match the URI for the
registered service.

Closes-Bug: 1689824
Change-Id: I309730a6daa8c3ea15fca78ab9ce910383019869
(cherry picked from commit b3c6035b7a1833a459fa0b5fd74ddcddd3740e00)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove trailing slash in nginx config

The nginx configuration file passes along traffic to the placement
API if the URI is '/placement/' but the service is registered with
keystone as just '/placement' (no trailing slash). This causes
nginx to send back the default page when nova services try to talk
to the placement API.

This patch fixes the nginx configuration to match the URI for the
registered service.

Closes-Bug: 1689824
Change-Id: I309730a6daa8c3ea15fca78ab9ce910383019869
(cherry picked from commit b3c6035b7a1833a459fa0b5fd74ddcddd3740e00)

commit_message:
Enable custom keystone endpoint_type in templates

Allow to specify a custom AUTH_URL for the templates in case instances
cannot reach internalURL which is the case in mose deployment.

A new variable in trust section: trustee_keystone_interface which
default to public for OSA.

Also set magnum_client URL which is passed to instances to publicURL
also, this is similar to what is done with heat which default to
publicURL.

Related to this change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455353/

Change-Id: I51bf7615ca91f90b7d998e66327ed1bb662783b6
Partial-Bug: #1643197

subject: Use uri module for git sourced configs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-12 10:40:15.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/gnocchi_post_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'message': 'Use uri module for git sourced configs

The current mechanism uses a lookup, causing the
fetch of the default templates to happen via curl
from the deployment node. This causes problems if
the deployment node does not have access to the
repo server web service, which may be the case in
high security environments.

This patch changes the mechanism to only use the
lookup module for the file content that is on the
deployment node, then falls back to using the uri
module to fetch the default content. This ensures
that the deployment node does not have to reach
into the environment for the content.

Change-Id: Ia067a7cd2bc4460462b55f4631eba6e8eb693b0f
'}]
commit_message:
Use uri module for git sourced configs

The current mechanism uses a lookup, causing the
fetch of the default templates to happen via curl
from the deployment node. This causes problems if
the deployment node does not have access to the
repo server web service, which may be the case in
high security environments.

This patch changes the mechanism to only use the
lookup module for the file content that is on the
deployment node, then falls back to using the uri
module to fetch the default content. This ensures
that the deployment node does not have to reach
into the environment for the content.

Change-Id: Ia067a7cd2bc4460462b55f4631eba6e8eb693b0f

subject: Perform an atomic policy file change
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-02 08:11:23.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/gnocchi_post_install.yml', 'tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/gnocchi_apache.yml', 'tasks/gnocchi_ceph_python_libs.yml', 'tasks/gnocchi_init_common.yml', 'tasks/gnocchi_init_systemd.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'tasks/gnocchi_install.yml'], 'message': 'Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the
services and is not only read on service start. We therefore
cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore
only put the policy file in place after the service restart.

This patch also tidies up the handlers and some of the install
tasks to simplify them and reduce the tasks/code a little.

Change-Id: Ib62c9b0c8d1081409b06c35d27421a28da22c796
(cherry picked from commit ff7854c5a52b096c2590e57aa420e8a846131de7)
'}]
commit_message:
Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the
services and is not only read on service start. We therefore
cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore
only put the policy file in place after the service restart.

This patch also tidies up the handlers and some of the install
tasks to simplify them and reduce the tasks/code a little.

Change-Id: Ib62c9b0c8d1081409b06c35d27421a28da22c796
(cherry picked from commit ff7854c5a52b096c2590e57aa420e8a846131de7)

subject: Fix race when consolidating new partition
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 16896, 'name': 'Ondřej Nový', 'email': 'novy@ondrej.org', 'username': 'onovy'}, {'_account_id': 23449, 'name': 'Pavel Kvasnička', 'email': 'pavel.kvasnicka@firma.seznam.cz', 'username': 'PavelK'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-15 19:24:14.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': 'Fix race when consolidating new partition

Suffix hash invalidations in hashes.invalid can be lost when two
concurrent calls to get_hashes consolidate the hashes of a new
partition with no hashes.pkl:

- suffix S has been invalidated and is listed in hashes.invalid
- process X calls get_hashes when there is no existing hashes.pkl
- process X removes hashes.invalids file in consolidate_hashes
- process X calculates the hash of suffix S (note, process X has
  not yet written hashes.pkl)
- process Y invalidates suffix S, appends S to hashes.invalid, so the
  hash of suffix S *should* be recalculated at some point
- process Z calls get_hashes->consolidate_hashes, deletes hashes.invalid
  because there is still no hashes.pkl
- process Z fails
- process X writes hashes.pkl with stale hash value for suffix S
- the invalidation of S that was made by process Y is lost

The solution is to never remove hashes.invalid during consolidate_hashes
without first recording any invalid suffixes in hashes and writing hashes
to disk in hashes.pkl. This is already the behaviour when hashes.pkl
exists. The cost of an additional write to hashes.pkl, introduced by this
patch, is only incurred once, when get_hashes first encounters a
partition with no hashes.pkl.

Related-Change: Ia43ec2cf7ab715ec37f0044625a10aeb6420f6e3

Change-Id: I08c8cf09282f737103e580c1f57923b399abe58c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race when consolidating new partition

Suffix hash invalidations in hashes.invalid can be lost when two
concurrent calls to get_hashes consolidate the hashes of a new
partition with no hashes.pkl:

- suffix S has been invalidated and is listed in hashes.invalid
- process X calls get_hashes when there is no existing hashes.pkl
- process X removes hashes.invalids file in consolidate_hashes
- process X calculates the hash of suffix S (note, process X has
  not yet written hashes.pkl)
- process Y invalidates suffix S, appends S to hashes.invalid, so the
  hash of suffix S *should* be recalculated at some point
- process Z calls get_hashes->consolidate_hashes, deletes hashes.invalid
  because there is still no hashes.pkl
- process Z fails
- process X writes hashes.pkl with stale hash value for suffix S
- the invalidation of S that was made by process Y is lost

The solution is to never remove hashes.invalid during consolidate_hashes
without first recording any invalid suffixes in hashes and writing hashes
to disk in hashes.pkl. This is already the behaviour when hashes.pkl
exists. The cost of an additional write to hashes.pkl, introduced by this
patch, is only incurred once, when get_hashes first encounters a
partition with no hashes.pkl.

Related-Change: Ia43ec2cf7ab715ec37f0044625a10aeb6420f6e3

Change-Id: I08c8cf09282f737103e580c1f57923b399abe58c

commit_message:
Remove auth_url

The `auth_url` option isn't actually an option. We use `auth_uri`
instead. We have patches up to fix the documentation around this, but
chances are it bled into our testing implementation as a side-effect.

This commit removes it from our tests because it's not useful and
it doesn't make sense.

Change-Id: I3f47c1f16dfe8d6ebca0185210a314a2b62a0248

In favor of the private i18n wrapper (_i18n), the public 'i18n' wrapper
has been deprecated for several releases. Each neutron CLI plugin
(not OSC plugin) should use its own i18n wrapper and the usage of
neutronclient.i18n wrapper was deprecated. It is time to drop this.

Also fixes test_exception.py which still consumed neutronclient.i18n.

Change-Id: I27a8ace2f31bea5e1d6bf8a5ebbbfa52a3228e73
"}]
commit_message:
Drop deprecated neutronclient.i18n wrapper

In favor of the private i18n wrapper (_i18n), the public 'i18n' wrapper
has been deprecated for several releases. Each neutron CLI plugin
(not OSC plugin) should use its own i18n wrapper and the usage of
neutronclient.i18n wrapper was deprecated. It is time to drop this.

Also fixes test_exception.py which still consumed neutronclient.i18n.

Change-Id: I27a8ace2f31bea5e1d6bf8a5ebbbfa52a3228e73

subject: Reduce init restart/kill times
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-03 13:13:39.000000000', 'files': ['templates/cloudkitty-systemd-init.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/cloudkitty_init_time_settings-cba85875093eac61.yaml'], 'message': "Reduce init restart/kill times

The systemd unit 'TimeoutSec' value which controls the time
between sending a SIGTERM signal and a SIGKILL signal when
stopping or restarting the service has been reduced from 300
seconds to 120 seconds. This provides 2 minutes for long-lived
sessions to drain while preventing new ones from starting
before a restart or a stop.

The 'RestartSec' value which controls the time between the
service stop and start when restarting has been reduced from
150 seconds to 2 seconds to make the restart happen faster.

These values can be adjusted by using the *_init_config_overrides
variables which use the config_template task to change template
defaults.

Change-Id: Ia10703ca1cfa5afd1dec09a52f1b981711796e33
(cherry picked from commit 5c7c223ab88bf7e462d0cd70c206f779bef676ec)
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce init restart/kill times

The systemd unit 'TimeoutSec' value which controls the time
between sending a SIGTERM signal and a SIGKILL signal when
stopping or restarting the service has been reduced from 300
seconds to 120 seconds. This provides 2 minutes for long-lived
sessions to drain while preventing new ones from starting
before a restart or a stop.

The 'RestartSec' value which controls the time between the
service stop and start when restarting has been reduced from
150 seconds to 2 seconds to make the restart happen faster.

These values can be adjusted by using the *_init_config_overrides
variables which use the config_template task to change template
defaults.

Change-Id: Ia10703ca1cfa5afd1dec09a52f1b981711796e33
(cherry picked from commit 5c7c223ab88bf7e462d0cd70c206f779bef676ec)
